intro: Richella discostigma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often cultivated for their ornamental value. Richella discostigma thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
